intro: Cestrum tuerckheimii var. laxius, commonly known as the lax-leaved yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its clusters of yellow, bell-shaped flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, bright yellow blooms that appear in the summer months. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil. The fragrance of its flowers is subtle and attracts various pollinators, including moths and bats.
